intro: Alsodeia fasciculata var. minor, commonly known as the lesser clustered alsike, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe. It features slender, creeping stems that root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. Its leaves are linear to lanceolate, often hairy, and arranged in whorls along the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
